content.text:
# Battle of Las Guasimas (1874)

| caption           =
| date              = 16–20 March 1874
| place             = Camagüey, Cuba
| result            = Cuban victory
| combatant1        =  Spanish Empire
| combatant2        =  Cuban separatists
| commander1        =  Brigadier Armiñán
| commander2        =  Major general Máximo Gómez Brigadier Antonio Maceo
| strength1         = 5,000
| strength2         = 2,050
| casualties1       = 1,037 killed, wounded, or missing
| casualties2       = 174 killed or wounded
| campaignbox       =
}}
The Battle of Las Guásimas (16–20 March 1874) was fought in Camagüey, Cuba. Some 2,050 rebels, commanded by Dominican major general Máximo Gómez, defeated 5,000 Spanish troops with 6 cannons. The five-day battle cost the Spanish 1,037 casualties and the rebels 174 casualties.
